main event: A round self-luminous object approximately 8 feet in diameter was observed hovering at low altitude in Fort Worth, Texas on 11 January 1962.
interesting points: The object hovered at about 20 feet for 5-7 minutes before rising into the sky., Witnesses reported it as causing ground illumination., The object had no apparent structure and was considered to be self-luminous., Some witness descriptions questioned the reliability, suggesting it might have been an optical illusion or a meteor., The sighting occurred under overcast conditions, contributing to the ambiguity of the observation.
witness description: The civilian observer reported seeing the object hover and rise, but their reliability was questioned.
